fields.space: The bright lounge area with stylish furnishings is the perfect place to relax after a day in The City, with large windows allowing lots of natural light into the room. The kitchen is where the magic happens; find a great dining area for sociable get-togethers and enjoy the ambience of this fully-equipped kitchen with a touch of unique character with its pictures and comfy chairs. The bedroom is simply second to none with large windows, a big comfy bed and carpet for a relaxed touch. Enjoy a shower in the seriously large bathroom; again with lots of storage space, huge mirrors, and bath and shower. The area is one of London’s best kept secrets hidden away from tourists and the development is located on a quiet street but with plenty of bars, pubs and restaurants just around the corner. Farringdon station is just a few minutes away, and from here you can easily reach the rest of London.

fields.neighborhood_overview: Your neighbourhood around Shoreditch is as happening as London gets. With fashion and design outlets lining the streets and alleyways of the local area and cool restaurants and cafés providing cuisine from around the globe, you are placed at the heart of London’s frontline of entertainment and style. In fact, you may never want to venture out beyond Shoreditch, but if you do you can easily get to the antique haven of Islington or the market streets of Clerkenwell during a leisurely stroll. The West End with all its attractions from the Theatre District to Covent Garden is also quite accessible from here, with Underground trains and busses connecting you in and out of town in around 15 minutes. The City of London is equally just at your doorstep; in fact, if you work in the City you will not need any sort of mass transport at all – you can just walk to every last powerhouse or hail a taxi if you’re in a rush. The developments around your area are all built with your convenience in mindw

fields.space: Born out of the medieval church grounds, the exciting area around Leonard Street has become home to tech experts and fashionistas alike, catering to the cutting-edge taste of London’s contemporary jet set. With everyday amenities and entertainment opportunities all within walking distance and convenient transportation links from nearby Old Street station linking you to all parts of London, there is no need to plan for major commutes or errand runs. Flatscreen TVs, luxurious toiletries and linen as well as complimentary WiFi make the option of staying inside the flat as attractive as roaming the streets for leisure time activities. You can enjoy our fully fitted kitchens and entertain to your heart’s content, or you can hit the local nightlife with amazing bars and avant-garde eateries. The world is your oyster – and Shoreditch is a great starting point to discover all that London has to offer. Old Street Apartments on Leonard Street are the latest addition to our collection of upmarket

fields.house_rules: At Glenthurston we try to allow guests freedom to enjoy their stay in London in the way they would like, but ask that respect is shown to the property and other guests at all times.  We don't allow smoking in the building, as it's law in the UK, and we ask smokers to move away from the building to prevent open windows allowing tobacco smells inside.  We don't allow large groups of all male/female/under 21s, and whilst we encourage bbqs in the summer, we ask guests to keep noise to a minimum outside after 11pm, that includes music being turned off.  The pool is open from 8am to 10pm and ask guests to respect timings as we add chemicals overnight. Additionally no glass of any kind is permitted in the pool area, guests must shower before using the pool and wear a swimming costume. There is no lifeguard so the pool is used entirely at guest's risk and under 14s must be supervised at all times. The sauna operates with £1 coins at £2 per hour. Again no under 14s without adult supervision.  T

fields.host_about: Self catering is widely known as a term in the uk.  I own and run Glenthurston Estates and have done since 1998. I have lived in London all my life and love it as a city. I have three grown up children, my partner Simon, his two girls and Bernie the dog. Glenthurston is a passion and I love every aspect of my business. Thanks to the internet I have shared my passion with many guests from around the world, so much so that we have just launched Ravensbourne House specifically for the many groups who have visited over the years. A new offering that is already proving popular and is an exciting new addition to the Glenthurston Estate.

fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio
fields.interaction: Please inquire to find out more and feel free to ask us any questions and let us know of any special requirements that you may have. fields.house_rules: At Glenthurston we try to allow guests freedom to enjoy their stay in London in the way they would like, but ask that respect is shown to the property and other guests at all times.  We don't allow smoking in the building, as it's law in the UK, and we ask smokers to move away from the building to prevent open windows allowing tobacco smells inside.  We don't allow large groups of all male/female/under 21s, and whilst we encourage bbqs in the summer, we ask guests to keep noise to a minimum outside after 11pm, that includes music being turned off.  The pool is open from 8am to 10pm and ask guests to respect timings as we add chemicals overnight. Additionally no glass of any kind is permitted in the pool area, guests must shower before using the pool and wear a swimming costume. There is no lifeguard so the pool is used entirely at guest's risk and under 14s must be supervised at all times. The sauna operates with £1 coins at £2 per hour. Again no under 14s without adult supervision.  T

fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio

fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio

We don't allow smoking in the building, as it's law in the UK, and we ask smokers to move away from the building to prevent open windows allowing tobacco smells inside.  We don't allow large groups of all male/female/under 21s, and whilst we encourage bbqs in the summer, we ask guests to keep noise to a minimum outside after 11pm, that includes music being turned off.  The pool is open from 8am to 10pm and ask guests to respect timings as we add chemicals overnight. Additionally no glass of any kind is permitted in the pool area, guests must shower before using the pool and wear a swimming costume. fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio

fields.transit: Whether you are shopping for luxury brands or following cultural events, the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea offers a wealth of choice. Some of London's most famous stores and shopping streets are to be found nearby: Harrods, Harvey Nichols, Sloane Street, Kensington Church Street. Cultural and Royal connections are evident in Kensington Palace, the Royal Albert Hall and the Victoria and Albert Museum. Kensington has a generous share of open space too. If you travel overseas regularly or simply want to establish a base in London, 375 Kensington High Street is the ideal address. From High Street Kensington Underground station you are three stops from Knightsbridge, five from Bond Street, and perfectly connected to everywhere else in the world. There are convenient Underground and road links to Heathrow, Gatwick, City Airport and St Pancras International station for the Eurostar. Buckingham Palace - 3.1 miles.

fields.transit: Our apartment is located on cromwell road which is part of a district in the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea in London. It is an inner-city district centred on Earl's Court Road and surrounding streets, located 3.1 miles (5 km) west south-west of Charing Cross. It borders the sub-districts of South Kensington to the East, West Kensington to the West, Chelsea to the South and Kensington to the North. There are some impressive examples of early- to mid-Victorian architecture in the Earls Court ward. Gardens such as Bramham Gardens and Courtfield Gardens are beautiful traditional residential squares with many imposing properties fronting onto them and in the case of Courtfield Gardens, traditional cast iron railings around the enclosed gardens have just been restored (the originals having been removed in 1940 for scrap iron during World War 2) creating a more authentic Victorian ambience. fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio

fields.space: The apartment is a self-contained single room studio flat (13 sq. metres) fully equipped with all your desired needs!  There is small desk space with an office chair, and its own personal WiFi router is provided. A double wardrobe containing plenty of hanging and storage space. Fully functional kitchen complete with a hob, microwave, toaster and kettle; alongside all cookware and utensils and its own fridge freezer. Its own private bathroom (pod), small but has everything you need. * Fully supplied with all bedding and towels * Complementary tea and coffee, and travel sized toiletries * Hairdryer can be found inside wardrobe for use The building benefits from a day and night concierge (excluding Sundays), an onsite gym and a communal area with flat screen TV with full Virgin Media package, Wi-Fi, comfortable sofas and a pool table to relax and enjoy! There is a laundry room in the basement of the building complete with ironing facilities and a coin operated washing machine and dryer.

fields.neighborhood_overview: The building, designated as a national historic landmark (Grade 1 listed) incorporates the St Pancras Renaissance Hotel (5 star Marriott), St Pancras Chambers (private apartments such as this) and Kings Cross St Pancras underground and train station below. On the edge of fashionable Bloomsbury, it is within walking distance of many of London's sights, from the British Library next door to the nearby British Museum with the West End less than 8 minutes by underground. Restaurants, pubs and shops can be found in abundance both in the building and adjacent hotel as well as the general viscinity including the nearby Brunswick Centre. The perfect hub from which to explore all that London has to offer.

fields.transit: When not on public transport (details below), I always use the Uber car service and recommend it highly. If you haven't used it before, download the app and use my referral code am9sj to get £10 off your first ride. Bus stops within 50m to take you literally anywhere in London. Chelsea and South ken are walking distance anyway, but buses to Sloane Square, Victoria, Waterloo, Notting Hill, Clapham, Brixton all very easy.

fields.neighborhood_overview: So, so much to do within walking distance. There are Italian, Spanish, Japanese, Mexican and Indian restaurants all within walking distance as well as 4 or 5 great pubs. There's even an indoor pool 150m away where you can swim for £4 a go. But Battersea Park is the real gem - 250m away from London's best park - the only one with riverside too. Lakes, cafés, woods and open spaces. Perfect for picnics if the weather is good. There's also a fantastic kids playground and adventure playground in Battersea Park.

fields.host_about:
Hi, welcome to my profile page. I live between Devon and London and work from home (running the non techie side of a software business) most of the time.

`Being fortunate enough to have two homes, one is always empty, which is a waste! So I love having Airbnb guests make the most of them instead.

I have a Dalmation called Bingo who goes everywhere with me. I'm a pilot in my spare time (small planes), I play the drums, am studying the piano, and love riding my motorbike. I wish I had more time to use the pool in Devon. I can't bear losing time in traffic, so I usually drive up/down between London and Devon late in the evening.
fields.interaction: First-time guests at short notice must call for contact and may be met on their first check in, but with a key pad entry system, you can also have total privacy with no need to meet anyone, if that's your preference. Otherwise, I'm always available by message to answer any questions.
fields.name: Luxury Battersea home w open fire, close to Park
fields.notes: There is double glazing providing good sound proofing but the road is noisy! Just imagine you're in New York! Although I have put "gym" and "pool" available they are not in the building. They are at the "Latchmere Centre" 100metres walk.
fields.summary: Stunning, cosy spacious open plan flat with underheated hard wood floors, leather sofa and King Size double leather sleigh bed, this flat is on a main road above a great Thai restaurant, in a fantastic location walking distance from many bars, cafés, shops & Battersea Park London's only park by the river. Vinyl record turntable, Netflix and Apple TV system, and 24hr check in.

fields.transit: Getting around is easy. We have 2 stations that serve London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross, Blackfriars and Victoria in less than 25 min journey. Trains run every 15 minutes till midnight. There are over a dozen bus routes at the end of the road. You do not need a car, if you bring one leave it on the drive for your stay unless you want to visit Kent and the surrounding countryside. The motorways south are a 25 minute drive.

fields.space: Family friendly accommodation in London. We are ideally situated to offer tourists easy access to central London's major sites, Greenwich and the Kent countryside is also accessible.  The large gardens have lawn and patio areas complete with furniture and for the children a variety of outdoor game equipment and swings. Each apartment has been converted to provide comfortable acommodation with excellent decor and furnished to a high standard. Internet access to all apartments.  All bed linen and towels are provided. Apartments are centrally heated. Lounge has leather corner sofa, flat screen tv, dining furniture, sideboard. At the end of the hall are two bedrooms. To the left the triple room which can be a king plus single. The kitchen is fully equipped with an oven, hob, dishwasher and microwave. The bathroom is first on right off hall. It has a large walk-in shower , toilet and basin The main bedroom is spacious with a kingsize or 2 single beds.

fields.house_rules: At Glenthurston we try to allow guests freedom to enjoy their stay in London in the way they would like, but ask that respect is shown to the property and other guests at all times.  We don't allow smoking in the building, as it's law in the UK, and we ask smokers to move away from the building to prevent open windows allowing tobacco smells inside.  We don't allow large groups of all male/female/under 21s, and whilst we encourage bbqs in the summer, we ask guests to keep noise to a minimum outside after 11pm, that includes music being turned off.  The pool is open from 8am to 10pm and ask guests to respect timings as we add chemicals overnight. Additionally no glass of any kind is permitted in the pool area, guests must shower before using the pool and wear a swimming costume. There is no lifeguard so the pool is used entirely at guest's risk and under 14s must be supervised at all times. The sauna operates with £1 coins at £2 per hour. Again no under 14s without adult supervision.  T

fields.host_about: Self catering is widely known as a term in the uk.  I own and run Glenthurston Estates and have done since 1998. I have lived in London all my life and love it as a city. I have three grown up children, my partner Simon, his two girls and Bernie the dog. Glenthurston is a passion and I love every aspect of my business. Thanks to the internet I have shared my passion with many guests from around the world, so much so that we have just launched Ravensbourne House specifically for the many groups who have visited over the years. A new offering that is already proving popular and is an exciting new addition to the Glenthurston Estate.
fields.interaction: I am on site one or two days a week. Simon, my manager, is available Mon - Fri, 9am to 5pm to make sure guests have everything they need. Outside these hours there is emergency contact numbers.

fields.space: This apartment is in a hidden oasis in one of the most vibrant and exciting areas of London! This unique space in London Fields, is a detached brand NEW apartment with floor to ceiling windows that open out onto a spacious private decked terrace. It is a ground floor flat, with one double bedroom and a very large reception with double sofa bed. It is situated next to London Fields, with good transport links to Liverpool St, Central London, The Olympic Park and all the Central London attractions. Location wise the property is round the corner from the famous E5 Bakery and Broadway Market with lots of lovely independent cafes and shops, especially good on Saturdays. The London Fields Lido outdoor heated 50m swimming pool is only a 3 mins walk away as is The Hackney Picture House. Good transport links to Westfield Shopping Centre, Stratford City, Liverpool Street Station and The Olympic Park. fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio

The accommodation offers a good size open plan living room with modern kitchen, access to a 40 square foot private balcony, a double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room.  This high-end apartment is part of Chelsea Creek - London's most elegant new dockside development, combining luxury city living with blissful tranquillity, moments from the stylish King's Road. Located in a prime central London residential location, on the north bank of the River Thames and adjacent to fashionable Chelsea Harbour and Imperial Wharf. Chelsea Creek benefits from a 24 hour concierge and is just seconds away from Imperial Wharf Station for the train or Chelsea Harbour for the River Bus.
fields.access: Collect keys from the concierge. You can get access to the apartment after 3pm on the day of arrival, and guests need to leave by 11am on the day of departure - unless otherwise agreed with the host.

fields.transit: The Flat is located just moments away from Canary Wharf Underground, this way you will have easy connections to Central London. The South East England region From this private holiday home/apartment you can enjoy the great location offered so you can begin your trip in Canary Wharf, tour the docks and the Docklands Museum. You can make your way to Greenwich and see the Observatory, the park and enjoy the Market at Cutty Sark. With the public transport from Canary Wharf or Heron Quays about 15 minutes you are in the Tower of London, Tower Bridge and other attractions. You can also visit Great Fire, St Paul's, Fleet Street, the West End and down to Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Scotland Yard are also within easy reach from the apartment. You can also access good transport links from London Bridge taking you to other major Cities in the UK.
fields.street: South Quay Walk, London, England E14 9SN, United Kingdom
fields.neighborhood_overview: With an iconic skyline towering over London, striking and dynamic architecture and a vibrant, cosmopolitan feel, Canary Wharf is firmly established as a first class shopping and leisure destination There are plenty of bars, pubs, restaurants, luxury stores to shop and a massive shopping mall. Canary Wharf is a major business district located in Tower Hamlets, London. It is one of the United Kingdom's two main financial centres – along with the traditional City of London – and contains many of the UK's tallest buildings, including the second-tallest, One Canada Square.

fields.host_about:
My name is Fabio and I along with my friend and colleague Willian will ensure to provide you a wonderful stay in our apartments across London.

Willian, Throughout his extensive travels, his unusual name – a derivative of William – has led to much curiosity. An Ecuadorian by birth, He has added to my higher education internationally, with economic studies in the USA, language training in Japan, and a BA and MBA in the United Kingdom.

I am a 37 year old professional, currently working and living in London, Willian is 30 year old professional, currently working and living in lively London. the most exciting and bigger property market in the world. During all this description of myself well mostly Willian, you will find out how travelling could probably be Willian's and I number 1 hobbie. Although, We do not see it as a hobby but a luxury :). We do also enjoy playing sports, attending concerts, going to the movies, clubbing, hanging out, cooking and much more! 

Airbnb is awesome. Willian remembers his first time using the portal was back in 2010, when he travelled to Tokyo to attend an university interview over there. He had booked an comfortable duplex apartment in Shinjuku from this lovely Japanese guy, Junichi. He was amazed to see the true meaning of hospitality, being a host is more than just being the doorman or the typical receptionist at concierge, it is being someone who receives, treat and entertains other people as guests. 

All my life Willian and I have dedicated quite a lot of time to travel around the globe where We have had the opportunity to meet amazing people and experienced other cultures, costumes, and more. That is exactly why I am currently working in the hospitality industry with my colleague and friend Fabio because what I have learned all these years travelling around is that hospitality is the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers not matter where people come from.

Fabio and I look forward welcoming and hosting some many guest in the upcoming years. I will truly give you my 100% to ensure your stay goes very well why you are staying at my apartments. I hope you enjoy the experience and adventure and thank you in advance :).

Your hosts,
Willian - Fabio

fields.transit: Getting to the apartment from Gatwick is easy. You can either use the Gatwick Express train service which brings you to Victoria underground station and from there an underground train to Gloucester Road underground Station.  Or Southern Trains also come from Gatwick into Victoria Station. Tickets are a little cheaper with them than the Gatwick Express. Or you can use (URL HIDDEN) which you would need to book in advance. You would ask to get the Easybus from Gatwick to Earls Court. A short No. 74 bus ride would then bring you to Cromwell Road outside of the apartment block. Getting to the apartment from Heathrow is just direct train on Piccadilly line to Gloucester Road underground Station.  If you needed a car parking space for a few days, we always able to find a spare one.
